byline.original: By KURT GRAY and CHELSEA SCHEIN

abstract: Gray Matter column by Prof Kurt Gray and graduate student Chelsea Schein describes their research, published in Journal of Experimental Psychology: General, on ways different ideological groups view victims in acts considered by them to be immoral; notes that research offers insight into ideas such as 'victimless crimes,' which are psychologically rare, and into why some conservatives view same-sex marriage as socially harmful.
lead_paragraph: It’s logically possible but psychologically rare.

headline.main: The Myth of the Harmless Wrong
headline.print_headline: The Myth of the Harmless Wrong

snippet: It’s logically possible but psychologically rare.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
